textList.name: AUTO_FREE_ITEMS
textList.text: You arrive in a system and immediately discover a pirate ship nearby. Strangely, scans indicate there are no lifeforms aboard. You salvage anything useful, but find no clue as to the whereabouts of the former crew.
Not much remains in this abandoned system; however, scans reveal a nearby mining platform with some salvageable materials.
Debris from a forgotten battle still orbits the gas giant in this system. Some of it still might be usable.
You happen upon the remains of an automated space station. It has been mostly picked clean but there appears to be a few materials that will aid you in your mission.

event.name: AUTO_ITEM_NAMED
event.text: There's some comm chatter at this beacon, and despite the fact that engineers are usually careful about that sort of thing, the channel is unsecured. It should be possible to listen in, if you so choose.
The message is a bit garbled at first, you have to move a certain distance into the system in order to pick up the message.

"...you if your stupid drones never do their delivery, then what's the damn point of them?" "My Auto-ships are top notch. You're probably screwing up the protocols." "Bah, you engineers and your protocols..." "What drone was tasked to deliver your supply drop?" "I can never keep their stupid names straight." "I believe the only one out on task right now is Miekkakala." "I'm never going to remember that." "See? That's a part of your problem. If you don't send them their own name, they won't be able to validate your identity. And it should be on your digital receipt." "Tch. Whatever, I'll get back to you when THAT doesn't work either."

"...you if your stupid drones never do their delivery, then what's the damn point of them?" "My Auto-ships are top notch. You're probably screwing up the protocols." "Bah, you engineers and your protocols..." "What drone was tasked to deliver your supply drop?" "I can never keep their stupid names straight." "I believe the only one out on task right now is Hwangsaechi." "I'm never going to remember that." "See? That's a part of your problem. If you don't send them their own name, they won't be able to validate your identity. And it should be on your digital receipt." "Tch. Whatever, I'll get back to you when THAT doesn't work either."

"...you if your stupid drones never do their delivery, then what's the damn point of them?" "My Auto-ships are top notch. You're probably screwing up the protocols." "Bah, you engineers and your protocols..." "What drone was tasked to deliver your supply drop?" "I can never keep their stupid names straight." "I believe the only one out on task right now is Mekajiki." "I'm never going to remember that." "See? That's a part of your problem. If you don't send them their own name, they won't be able to validate your identity. And it should be on your digital receipt." "Tch. Whatever, I'll get back to you when THAT doesn't work either."

"...you if your stupid drones never do their delivery, then what's the damn point of them?" "My Auto-ships are top notch. You're probably screwing up the protocols." "Bah, you engineers and your protocols..." "What drone was tasked to deliver your supply drop?" "I can never keep their stupid names straight." "I believe the only one out on task right now is Espadon." "I'm never going to remember that." "See? That's a part of your problem. If you don't send them their own name, they won't be able to validate your identity. And it should be on your digital receipt." "Tch. Whatever, I'll get back to you when THAT doesn't work either."

"...you if your stupid drones never do their delivery, then what's the damn point of them?" "My Auto-ships are top notch. You're probably screwing up the protocols." "Bah, you engineers and your protocols..." "What drone was tasked to deliver your supply drop?" "I can never keep their stupid names straight." "I believe the only one out on task right now is Miecznik." "I'm never going to remember that." "See? That's a part of your problem. If you don't send them their own name, they won't be able to validate your identity. And it should be on your digital receipt." "Tch. Whatever, I'll get back to you when THAT doesn't work either."

"...you if your stupid drones never do their delivery, then what's the damn point of them?" "My Auto-ships are top notch. You're probably screwing up the protocols." "Bah, you engineers and your protocols..." "What drone was tasked to deliver your supply drop?" "I can never keep their stupid names straight." "I believe the only one out on task right now is Swordfish." "I'm never going to remember that." "See? That's a part of your problem. If you don't send them their own name, they won't be able to validate your identity. And it should be on your digital receipt." "Tch. Whatever, I'll get back to you when THAT doesn't work either."
You could use some peace and quiet - this is a Rebel sector after all.

event.name: AUTO_ITEM_NAMED_BOT
event.text: An Auto notices that you've ventured out from the beacon and approaches your ship. Its engines are fully charged. "Your digital courier has arrived! You were 28 minutes late to receive your supplies - this courier was about to depart. Now that you are here, please verify your identity by stating the name of the courier assigned to deliver your package!"
"Detecting hostility! Returning to sender." The ship makes haste and leaves immediately. As it had implied earlier, its jump engines were already charged. There's nothing more that can be done here.
"Identity confirmed. Sending supplies. We hope you have a wonderful day!"
"Incorrect response. Returning to supply depot. If this is an error, please contact your service provider."

event.name: AUTO_SUPPORT
event.text: Luckily, the Auto-Support at this beacon is not designed for combat. If you were to convince it that you were a Rebel ship, maybe it will give you supplies.

choice.text: Simply transmit your fake ID and hope for the best.
(Hacking) Reprogram the ship to distribute to Federation ships as well.

event.text: It appears that your injected code works. "Identification authorized. Dispensing supplies."

choice.text: (Hacking Weapon) Disrupt the ship's AI so that it will distribute to your ship.

event.text: Your weapon is able to jam the enemy ship's ability to tell friend from foe. It glitches momentarily, then relents. "Identifi-fi-fication authorized-ized. Dispensing su-supplies."

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Reprogram the ship to distribute to Federation ships as well.

event.text: It appears that your Engi's modifications work. "Identification authorized. Dispensing supplies."

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Reprogram the ship to distribute to Federation ships as well.

event.text: It appears that your Engineer's modifications work. "Identification authorized. Dispensing supplies."
It's not likely you can trick an AI vessel. You let it continue on its way.
"Identification invalid. True identity: Federation vessel. Activating combat mode."
"Rebel ship detected. Dispensing supplies."

event.name: ENGINEER_BUY_DRONES
event.text: A Rebel Engineer hails you. "I know this is a bit unconventional, but we are in need of drone-parts. We'll pay you in any other resource you want."
You prepare to attack the engineers.
You're good with what you have.

event.name: AUTO_BIRDLY_BOT
event.text: As you arrive at the next beacon, the communications console lights up like a Christmas tree. Every single channel is broadcasting the exact same message originating from a nearby arboreal planet. The contents of the call is a whimsical song about birds that you recognize as originating from human history, at max volume and double the usual BPM. After receiving the hail, a small Auto-ship begins flying towards your location from the planet's biosphere. "QUERY: Bird?"

"SCANNING. Error. SCANNING. Error. Major sensor driver malfunction. Utilizing audio verification." The Auto-ship begins to play a pleasant bird tune through your speakers, and Wealsey responds in kind, singing its beautiful song. Your ship transmits the audio back to the Auto-ship. "Audio mismatch. Bird species incorrect. Conclusion: bird lovers detected. Dispensing aid to bird-lovers."

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Offer to diagnose and fix the malfunction.
(Engi Crew) Offer to diagnose and fix the malfunction.

event.text: "MISSION PARAMETERS: Find the Kestrel---[DATA CORRUPTION]. 99% of mission information lost. Data restoration, extrapolation using local communications broadcast indicates a 1.2% probability that original mission parameters included the logging, protection and tracking of Kestrel species. This planet: only nearby planet containing Kestrel species. Additional, subsequent systems failures resulted in malfunction in onboard sensor drivers. Flock: lost. Request assistance."

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Offer to diagnose and fix the malfunction.
(Engi Crew) Offer to diagnose and fix the malfunction.
(Sensors) Take some time gathering some sensor readings for the Auto-ship.

event.text: You spend some time taking readings all across the surface. It takes a long time, but eventually the Auto-ship is satisfied that it has found what it is looking for. It dispenses a modest amount of scrap and returns to the biosphere of the planet.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Gather some sensor readings for the Auto-ship.

event.text: Your detailed sensor suite already scanned the entire planet. You transmit your sensor information to the Auto-ship, and are rewarded with a modest amount of scrap.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Gather some readings for the Auto-ship.

event.text: Your detailed scanner suite already scanned the entire planet. You transmit your information to the Auto-ship, and are rewarded with a modest amount of scrap.

choice.text: Apologize and say you can't help.

event.text: "Ornithophobe detected. Violence is justified." The Auto-ship immediately powers weapons.
You decide not to dignify the query with a response. The Auto-ship immediately loses interest and returns to the biosphere of the planet.

event.name: AUTO_BIRDLY_BOT_GOODBYE
event.text: With nothing more to do, you disengage from the Auto-ship. It immediately loses interest and returns to the biosphere of the planet.

event.name: BIRDLY_BOT_FIX
event.text: "Offer accepted. Deploying memory core." Your crew examines the Auto-ship's memory core. Almost all of the memory is corrupted, and it's hard to tell what this ship used to be from data analysis alone. Your crew purges the unsalvageable data from the system, fixes the hardware issues and uploads the latest Federation standard drivers into all of its systems. Once the ship comes back online, it immediately whirs to life with more vigor than it had before. "Scanning. All kestrel specimens found and accounted for. Federation ship: has done great service in environmental conservation. Deploying gratitude." The ship dispenses a modest amount of supplies before departing.

event.name: AUTO_ZOLTAN_FACILITY
event.text: In the distance appears to just be an ordinary planet, though the vast complex built on the surface interests you. Further scans reveal a morbid truth - a primarily automated Auto-ship factory running entirely on Zoltan slave power has been constructed on the surface!

You fly closer to the surface and are immediately met by a large Auto-Battleship, but it's not attacking yet. "This is Dr. Peron Anderson. Your vessel has been spotted coming concerningly close to the facility. We suggest either stating your business or getting lost."
The scientist sighs, then ends the call. Weapons spring out of the Auto-ship's hull, and it's time for a brawl.
"You... want one of our power sources? Well, I guess we don't need THIS many of them, and the scrap is handy... alright, you've got a deal."
You'd have to be insane to tangle with such a massive structure that's undoubtedly of high value to the Rebels.
You move in to intercept the automated vessel.
You have no interest in the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_AUTO_YARD_CHOICE
textList.text: You have discovered a dormant Auto-ship at this beacon. It makes no attempt to attack you, but the low power signatures from it suggest it is still functional.
An Auto-ship patrolling the sector has not yet spotted you at this beacon.
A prerecorded message plays over the intercomm. "It is advised that you do not attack this ship."
It appears it is not within the programming of the Auto-ship at this beacon to instigate combat. That doesn't mean however that it won't fight back should you choose to attack.

event.name: AUTO_FOREST
event.text: This beacon has been set up close to a lush forest planet. As you navigate closer to the surface, you can just barely make out a Rebel supply platform. It's likely staffed by a few Engineers, but nothing you can't manage.

choice.text: (Adv. Hacking) Disrupt any potential defenses the platform may have.

event.text: Your sophisticated hacking system easily breaches whatever firewalls the platform may have had in place. Now defenseless against your assault, they quickly surrender.

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Disrupt any potential defenses the platform may have.

event.text: You attack the platform, making sure to disrupt any signals to their defenses. Once the engineers staffing the platform realize that their defenses aren't working properly, they promptly surrender.
There's likely a defense system lying in wait for you. You abandon the platform.
As you approach the station, an automated ship comes flying out from its hiding place in the forest and attacks! You're forced to flee as the ship chases you.
The platform was better defended than you were prepared for. Several Engineers are beamed onto your ship, and a powerful artillery cannon penetrates your defenses.
The Engineers are sent scattering as you attack the station. Not prepared in any way for combat, they're forced to surrender.

event.name: AUTO_ENGINEERS_SAVE
event.text: A ship full of Rebel engineers is under fire from a pirate vessel. They hail you, and request that you save them.
You move in to intercept the pirate vessel.

choice.text: We aren't going to help any damn Rebels.

event.text: You leave the two ships to continue fighting.

event.name: AUTO_ENGINEERS_SAVE_WIN
event.text: The engineer ship is in poor condition. "I... I didn't expect you to actually help. I have no ship left, no crew... nothing. I suppose it will do me no harm to work aboard yours."

event.name: AUTO_PIRATE_CHOICE
event.text: At this beacon you discover a pirate and Auto-ship fighting each other. Neither notices you.
You move in to intercept the automated vessel.
You move in to intercept the pirate ship.
You leave the two ships to continue fighting.

event.name: AUTO_PIRATE_CHOICE_AUTO_WIN
event.text: "We weren't expecting support from a Federation ship. To be fair, I was looking forward to scrapping that ship. Despite this, I may be a pirate, but I am still a man who doesn't like keeping a debt. So here, take this garbage."

event.name: AUTO_PIRATE_CHOICE_PIRATE_WIN
event.text: "Logic error: Federation ship provided aid in combat. Conflicting internal code... requires reboot." The Auto-ship turns offline. You take this chance to scrap it.

event.name: AUTO_MINER
event.text: Inside the asteroid field at this beacon is a mining platform and an Automated Salvager ship. The Salvager does not notice you as it mines away at the asteroids.

choice.text: Attack the ship to get to the platform.

event.text: You prepare to engage the Auto-ship.
Fighting a mining ship in its natural habitat of an asteroid field doesn't sound like a good idea.

event.name: AUTO_MINER_PLATFORM
event.text: The automated platform holds many fuel cells freshly mined from the asteroid field. You take all that you can.

event.name: AUTO_BOMB_MANUFACTURE
event.text: An Automated ship is patrolling what appears to be a ammunition manufacturing plant. You can't access the factory while the ship is in the way.
You prepare to engage the Auto-ship.
You aren't interested in raiding the factory.

event.name: AUTO_BOMB_MANUFACTURE_FACTORY
event.text: Now that the patrol ship has been taken out, the automated factory has begun to sound an alarm. A robotic voice counts down a timer until the factory explodes. You only have time to grab one thing if you want to escape unharmed.
You grab as much ammunition as you can carry and fly away before the factory can explode.
You grab the nearest ballistic weapon and fly away before the factory can explode.

choice.text: Grab all that you can, even if it means taking some damage.

event.text: You grab the nearest ballistic weapon and as much ammunition as you can carry. Luckily you escape before the explosion can do critical damage to the hull, but several chunks of debris collide with it regardless, inflicting some damage.

event.name: REBEL_AUTO_SPY
event.text: This beacon hosts an automated ship, but not of the usual variety. It's a Surveyor, a class deployed by the Rebels to scout out sectors autonomously. If you can capture its black box, you should be able to access the data.
Luckily Auto-ship black boxes can survive most damage from combat. Destroy the ship and the data is yours.
The Rebel's data is intriguing, but you have decided against messing with the Surveyor.

event.name: REBEL_AUTO_SPY_ESCAPING
event.text: "This Automated ship has taken damage in combat. It will now proceed to escape. Do not cause further damage to this ship." Now that the Surveyor has seen you, if it can get away it'll report your location to the fleet!

event.name: REBEL_AUTO_SPY_GOTAWAY
event.text: The Surveyor jumps away, and will no doubt report your location to the fleet next.

event.name: REBEL_AUTO_SPY_WIN
event.text: You scrap the remains of the Auto-Surveyor, and bring aboard its black box. You have two options, either transmit false data to the Rebels to delay them, or download it to get a sector map.
This should delay them for a while, or at least until they realize it's a hoax.
The Surveyor appears to have collected highly detailed data on the sector. This should help considerably.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUTO_REPAIRS
event.text: An automated ship emitting this distress beacon signal is looping a message in a calming female voice. "This automated vessel has received critical hull damage. It has been programmed to give a reward to anyone who repairs it."
A long bent arm comes out of the Auto-ship and collects the scrap. You watch in fascination as it patches itself back together.
The damaged ship is in horrible condition, but it still manages to raise its weapons and defend itself.
You'd have to be an absolute idiot to invest time into repairing an enemy Auto-ship.

event.name: DESTROYED_AUTO_DAMAGED
event.text: Barely anything remains that can be scrapped from the Auto-ship.
Nearly a second after the Auto-ship finished repairing itself, the Auto-ship detects you as an enemy and attacks!
"Repairs complete. Thank you for your service. As promised, here is your reward. Glory to the Rebellion!" The Auto-ship spits out a drone and jumps away.
"Repairs complete. Thank you for your service. As promised, here is your reward. Glory to the Rebellion!" The Auto-ship spits out an augment and jumps away.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUTO_TRASH
event.text: The only thing present at this beacon is a small system, barely more than a planet. Even from a distance, you can tell it's devoid of life - most likely stripped clean for the production of Auto-ships and their facilities. Surprisingly, your ship can pick up a faint distress signal originating from the surface. Given that it's closer to a ball of rock than anything that could support life, it's possible that it's just a faulty transponder from some half-finished Auto. It could still be worth checking out, though.
Even if the planet looks completely inhospitable, you can't just leave a distress signal. You pilot your ship down into the atmosphere and head towards the surface.

The surface of the planet is cluttered with trash everywhere you look. As you approach the signal, the chaotic spread seems to become more ordered. By the time you're right on top of it, the sprawl of garbage has been replaced with spires of compacted garbage.

The source of the signal becomes apparent soon after. A maintenance drone trundles by, carrying another block of trash. You begin to wonder how long it's been here for, but then it notices you and begins to wave wildly. It can't speak, but it seems... excited? Finding a place to land among all the clutter is a challenge, but the drone rushes towards you as soon as you do.

choice.text: (Orchid Children) Give the drone some plant matter.

event.text: The drone cradles the plants gently, then looks at you and makes a "stay here" motion. You watch as it carefully stores the children within itself before zooming away into the spires. A few minutes later, it reappears carrying a block of scrap larger than itself! You have to help it carry its bounty aboard the ship, but you can't find it in you to complain - this is a lot of scrap.
You find it unlikely that there's anything to be found down there - these are Rebel-controlled shipyards after all, and no human could survive down there. You prepare to jump away.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUTO_MILITIA_CHAIN
event.text: The moment you arrive, you begin detecting weapon discharge signatures. A Rebel Engineer is being chased by a Militia vessel, itself being chased by an Auto-ship. Both the Militia ship and the Rebel Engineer are broadcasting distress signals.

choice.text: Chase down the Engineer to let the Militia focus on the Auto.

event.text: As you corner the Engineer, the Militia ship sends you a message. "Thank goodness you're here. Try to capture them alive if you can!"

choice.text: Attack the Auto to give the Militia some breathing room.

event.text: The Auto-ship breaks off its attack to respond to your threat.
All the ships involved keep taking damage, but the fight eventually leaves your periphery.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUTO_MILITIA_CHAIN_GOTAWAY_DURING_FIGHT
event.text: The Engineer jumps away from the Militia before they manage to disable their vessel. The Militia captain yells "Get back here!" over the open channel, and jumps after them. It seems your fight has become a one on one engagement.

event.name: DISTRESS_AUTO_MILITIA_CHAIN_GOTAWAY
event.text: The Militia captain sighs. "Dammit. We almost had them. All this time chasing them into their territory for nothing, and our defenses are still compromised. We're sitting ducks for whenever the Rebels attack next." Annoyed, they jump away.

event.name: AUTO_GHOST_WANTWRECK
event.text: You arrive in orbit above a barren planet. The only noteworthy feature on its surface is a large Vagabond camp, a rarity in a sector so hostile to Ghosts. You wonder whether or not to contact them until you receive a message from them. "Salutations, mysterious 'not a Rebel'. Though we are currently satiated with our ample bounty of discarded vessels, we find ourselves constantly pondering over a matter most elusive and difficult. But first, have you perchance, heard of the scarlet-clad demons sometimes wielded by the Rebellion?"

"Wonderful! Then we shall gloss over the protracted explanations I was so begrudgingly prepared to dole out. As you can see behind us, we are well acquainted with the internals of various more unremarkable ships. But having recently caught eye of a scarlet demon, we were struck by insatiable curiosity about what might lie within. But alas, to no avail, as it was more than a fair-handed fight for us. I daresay, we were lucky to escape with our very mortality intact! But perhaps your arsenal might be more of a match for it?"
The Vagabonds send you the coordinates of the ship they want you to defeat, and wish you good luck.

"Very well, we shall share with you all the wisdom we can bring to bear. As you should invariably bear knowledge of, the Rebellion makes extensive application of, uh, how does your vernacular refer to them again? "Auto-ships?" But among such devilspawn, there are some adorned with scarlet hues, and branded with some unknowable white insignia. We happened upon one the other day, inquisitive as to what its interiors may bear compared to its less distinguished brethren. It was regrettably too much for our capabilities - though you appear capable of reducing it to naught but a crimson wreck. Would this proposal be of intrigue to you?"
The Vagabonds send you the coordinates of the ship they want you to defeat, and wish you good luck.
The Vagabonds cut comms, but not before sending you one final message. "You are a person of most dreary and uninteresting character! May you never besmirch us with your presence again!"

event.name: AUTO_GHOST_WANTWRECK_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Vagabond camp has asked you to destroy a powerful Auto-ship here.

event.text: You find the Auto-ship the Vagabonds wanted you to hunt down soon after arriving at this beacon. It doesn't seem to have spotted you yet, but you won't have long until it does see you.
The Auto-ship detects your hostile intentions, and moves to retaliate in turn.

event.name: AUTO_GHOST_WANTWRECK_QUEST_WIN
event.text: You've destroyed the Auto-ship as the Vagabonds requested. You pick up a few loose pieces of wreckage scattered around, but what now?

choice.text: Wait for the Vagabonds to arrive.

event.text: A wrecked ship jumps in not long after you've finished destroying the Auto-ship. The Vagabonds inside move to inspect the wreckage carefully. "Hmm, the innards of this machination are most fascinating. The construction is most exquisite, and even the wiring would seem to be done with a remarkable care for the finer details." They then proceed to discard the ship's internal computer, before taking full control of the ship.

"Your accomplishment here was one we could not hope to match. Please, accept our wholehearted gratitude for your fine deed here today." One of the Vagabonds, so impressed by your performance, wishes to join your crew.
You opt to try and salvage as much as possible before the Vagabonds arrive. You find a functioning Sentry weapon in the remaining wreckage.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUTO
textList.text: You discover one of the Rebel's autonomous scouts. The ship's AI wastes no time in engaging your ship.
Your ship is hailed: "This is an automated message. Resisting our takeover is pointless. Prepare to die." It appears this Rebel ship is run by an AI.
A Rebel autonomous vessel is exploring this beacon. You attempt to hide behind a nearby moon, but the ship finds you and begins its assault.
The AI of a nearby small Rebel auto-ship immediately identifies you as a threat and engages.
A Rebel ship moves in to engage. You attempt to open communications, but realize the futility of that action when you see the ship is run by an AI.
This must be one of the Rebels' unmanned scout ships. Looks like there's no way around a fight.
Another unmanned ship patrols this area. You prepare the ship for combat.
This beacon is being patrolled by an unmanned scout. A fight is unavoidable.
A small shuttle appears on the local radar. Turns out it is a Rebel automated scout!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AUTO_HACKER
event.text: Your arrival is greeted by numerous computer alerts. The nearby automated Rebel Hacker has used a local satellite in conjunction with its Hacking to deploy a virus to disrupt your Shields System. Hopefully it won't cause further problems before you can destroy it.
Your hacking system automatically counters the digital assault and you move in to fight the ship.
Your Anti-Virus automatically counters the digital assault and you move in to fight the ship.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AUTO_SUN
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to find yourself dangerously close to a star. An automated Rebel ship, impervious to the heat, moves in to engage.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AUTO_ASTEROID
event.text: You arrive in an asteroid belt to discover that a Rebel automated-scout has been stationed here. Prepare for a fight!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ENGINEER
textList.text: Though the primary Rebel fleet mostly avoids this sector, their Engineer vessels can still be found somewhat frequently. One of these ships has already arrived at this beacon and wastes no time to attack your ship.
You're hailed by a gruff looking Rebel engineer. "Frankly, I'm not paid enough for this job. Though at the same time, if I kill you maybe I'll get a raise!"
Only the Rebels could see the opportunity to make their engineer ships just as deadly as their primary fleet. One such ship spots you and attacks!
A Rebel Engineer ship is exploring this beacon. "Damn it, you should know very well that this sector is off limits!"

The Rebel Engineers are tasked with repairing damaged Auto-ships in this sector. That doesn't mean they aren't willing to get into a brawl with passing Federation ships. The ship here is evidence of this.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ENGINEER_SALVAGE
event.text: An engineer ship at this beacon is busy repairing a broken Auto-ship. As soon as they see you, they abandon the wreck and attack.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ENGINEER_SALVAGE_WIN
event.text: You scrap what remains of the automated wreck.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AUTO_ELITE
event.text: A Rebel Auto-ship advances towards you with clear intent, and while hostile Auto-ships are (unfortunately) a normal occurrence for you, this one is no usual sight. Its elegant and pristine figure suggests this is one of the more refined automatons produced in the heart of Wentworth Innovations. Battle stations!

event.name: AUTO_ENGINEER_MISTAKE
event.text: A damaged Engineer vessel orbits this beacon. It appears to still be functional, and a single hull repair drone is patching up some of the damage.

"Ugh, you aren't here to kill us, are you?" You shake your head. "Oh, good. In that case, maybe you could help us. We had an issue with a cognitive prototype we were working on. After the Free Roamer incident, the Rebellion banned all attempts at creating fully sentient ship AI. We uh... we broke that rule, and it was a terrible mistake. Now the Auto-ship has escaped. You don't suppose you could track it down and destroy it? We can't let command know about this slip-up..."
These guys make an easy target. You arm the weapons.
The Engineer makes no attempt to hail you in return. Just in case, you put a little distance between your ships.

event.name: AUTO_ENGINEER_MISTAKE_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of the rogue Rebel cognitive.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've arrived at the co-ordinates given by the Engineers, but instead you've found a crashed starliner converted into a massive city bustling with pirates. A prime place to find a rogue AI, but not an easy one to search through.

Fortunately, the pirates don't really seem to care that you're a Federation officer. Living so close to Rebel space, it's probably a nice change of pace if anything. Asking around about a rogue cognitive however turns up confusing results. Most people have no idea what a cognitive is, and most redirect you to speak with the king of the city.

You step into a massive, cobbled together tower of spliced cargo containers and the hulls of former Rebel ships. In the center sits a throne, on which rests a rotund man with a black paper hat staring down upon you. He isn't particularly imposing, save for the buzzsaw that apparently has replaced his left hand. "I see yee have found me in my d-d-dominion. Welcome, matey!"

The man 'stands' up, revealing he in-fact has no feet, but rather a set of treads. He rolls towards you, and it becomes clear this is no man at all, but rather a ramshackle Doctor Drone. "Arg, I be Cap'ain A5540L3, at your service. How might I help you, lad?" The drone sticks out his left hand to shake yours before he remembers his situation, and so quickly stuffs it behind his back and reaches out his right instead, which is instead a much less imposing but still concerning blaster arm from a Battle Drone.
This mission isn't worth stirring up an entire city of pirates. You pull away from the city.

event.name: A55_HANDSHAKE
event.text: You carefully grab his arm cannon and shake it up and down a few times. "Arg, mighty grip you've got there, lad! Now, surely there's a reason the Federation's come prodding around here."

event.name: A55_FIGHT
event.text: It doesn't take a genius to realize this is the cognitive in question, and you waste no further time explaining the situation to him. "Hmmm. Sounds grave, matey. You surely understand I'm not just gonna r-r-roll out of here with you."

choice.text: Then we have a standoff, don't we?

event.text: "Arg, it would appear so." A55 does his best to clap, then whistles. Seconds later, a massive Auto-Dreadnaught comes whirling by through a hole in the ceiling of the massive throne room. "Last chance lad, I don't wanna cause no bloodshed t-t-today."

Curiously, A55's massive vessel makes no attempt to fight you until you get into your cruiser, though it easily could have blown your crew away during the run. You have no time to contemplate this further, it's time to fight!
You turn and walk out of the room. A55 watches you leave in mild amusement and confusion.

event.name: A55_DEFEAT
event.text: Suddenly, the Dreadnaught shuts offline, falling to the ground. In the distance approaches the engineers from earlier, here to collect their AI. You don't have time to hail them before you receive another hail from A55. "Please matey, don't hand me over. They'll tear me apart and turn me offline! That's no proper fate for a pirate, arg!"

You grab the medic drone, carting him over to the Engineers. "He's integrated himself into a new chassis? Incredible! It's a shame we'll have to destroy it, but at least this drone will look cool as a trophy. Don't speak of this to anyone."

choice.text: Lie to the Engineers, tell them the Auto-ship is A55.

event.text: A55 hides while you inform the engineers about the Auto-ship, which they briefly scan. The engineer frowns, "Huh, I can see traces of his programming here, but it looks like the core migrated to a new chassis. This must have been a distraction, we'll have to keep searching. Here's your pay or something. Don't speak of this to anyone."

"Thank you, matey. Arg, though you did choose to try and murder me a few minutes ago, your heart is clearly in the right place lad. I suspect my time here as king might be short lived, those Engineers will come around again. But as I prepare to leave, take this."

"Thank you, matey. Arg, though you did choose to try and murder me a few minutes ago, your heart is clearly in the right place lad. I suspect my time here as king might be short lived, those Engineers will come around again. I think I shall come with you, in hopes I might live to see a future without Rebels. Let me send you over some scans o' me ship - not the one you destroyed, but one I plundered from the Rebel databanks back in the day."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The reactor will detonate in this much time. Nothing can stop this, so make sure to jump away or end the fight before it reaches 0!

event.name: AUTO_POWERCORE
event.text: It appears a large generator has been sculpted onto the face of a nearby snow planet. It's quite a spectacle, but something is wrong...

A battalion of pirate ships flies away, chased off by a distant Rebel ship. A warning plays over the intercom. "It is recommended that all personnel evacuate Power Grid 800 immediately. Catastrophic reactor failure is imminent. Estimated 3 minutes remaining until collapse."

choice.text: There's time left, swing by and try to salvage some supplies.

event.text: As you move in to salvage, you're stopped by a large Engineer vessel. "Damn pirates! We told you to get the hell out of here!" Though the ship moves in to chase you off, you can't help but notice that reactor countdown is still going, and you figure the Engineers must know as well.

event.name: AUTO_POWERCORE_ESCAPE
event.text: Suddenly, the Engineer ship jumps away so abruptly, they must have used an MV drive, leaving you alone with the power core. You receive another warning from the core. "Warning: Reactor instability has reached 99%. Destruction is imminent. Evacuate immediately. Estimated 3 seconds remaining until collapse."

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Get the hell out of there.
(Adv. Engines) Get the hell out of there.

event.name: AUTO_POWERCORE_DEFEAT
event.text: You've defeated the Engineer ship, but that victory won't last for long. You receive another warning from the core. "Warning: Reactor instability has reached 99%. Destruction is imminent. Evacuate immediately. Estimated 3 seconds remaining until collapse."

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Get the hell out of there.
(Adv. Engines) Get the hell out of there.

event.name: AUTO_POWERCORE_ALMOSTBOOM
event.text: The Engineer ship has taken critical damage. Before you can get in a finishing shot you're interupted by another alarm. "Warning: Reactor instability has reached 97%. Evacuate the premises immediately. Estimated 1 minute remaining until collapse."

choice.text: Urge the Engineers to stop fighting.

event.text: "You think we can just leave? It's a better fate to blow the hell up than face Vance's wrath! I'd rather die fighting the Federation and become a martyr than-" The engineers are cut off by another warning. "Warning: Reactor instability has reached critical levels. Destruction imminent, evacuation mandatory. Time remaining: undetermined. Repeat: reactor-" The message continues to loop, and it seems like it's a good warning. Surely, there's something you can do to stop the explosion?

choice.text: Send in your crew to fix the reactor, and quickly!

event.text: You pull closer to the power core, and drop off your crew. They hurry inside to the control panel, which is sparking. There's 3 buttons, but their labels are barely legible. Pressing one of them might save the day, but you have no idea which.
Your crew flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can. Now you can only hope it worked...
Your crew flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can. Now you can only hope it worked...
Your crew flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can. Now you can only hope it worked...

You rapidly flip through the manual, and sure enough under the section for "Rebel Automated Power Core Explosion Prevention Protocols" it clearly states to press the red button. You relay this to the crew, who flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can.

Your engineer searches deep through their memories and remembers a staff training day where they explained the importance of each button. Recalling the red button was the correct solution, you relay this to the crew who flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can.

You power up the engines and fly as far away as you can, and watch from a distance as the mothership is consumed by a massive explosion that rips through the planet's surface leaving a crater so large you can see it all the way from the other side of the system. You pull a little closer and scrap the wreckage on the outer rim, though the center is leaking heavy radiation and is not safe to journey towards.

choice.text: Keep fighting to the bitter end.

event.name: AUTO_POWERCORE_BIGBOOM
event.text: An ear splitting explosion reverbs throughout the ship as a deadly inferno consumes the power core. Your ship is caught in the explosion, and takes heavy damage. You fly away as quickly as possible, your engines burning up as you go.

event.name: AUTO_POWERCORE_BIGBOOM_ESCAPE
event.text: You speed away from the power core as fast as you possible can. You escape the initial explosion, but much of the debris still collides with your ship, causing damage to the hull.

event.name: AUTO_POWERCORE_BIGBOOM_ESCAPE_GOOD
event.text: Your advanced engines are easily able to get you out in time. You watch the explosion from a safe distance.

event.name: AUTO_POWERCORE_SAVE
event.text: A loud beep emanates from the console. "Emergency Reactor Meltdown Prevention button pressed. Stopping countdown to imminent explosion. Reactor stabilized." By some incredible miracle, it appears you've stopped the explosion.
The Engineers are amazed. "I-I didn't even know that button was a thing! You've saved all of us... but why? Why put your life on the line just to save a Rebel facility?"

"Perhaps we are fighting for the wrong side here... Regardless, we must leave this facility at once. Vance won't be happy we let that pirate raid almost destroy the reactor and I doubt he'd let us live through it. I'll come with you, and bring everything that I can with me."
